question: Given, a current carrying wire of non-uniform cross-section, which of the following is constant throughout the length of wire?
choices: Current, electric field and drift speed
explanation: In a series circuit (or single wire), conservation of charge dictates that the current (I) is the same at every cross-section.
Drift speed <katex>$v_d = I/(nAq)$</katex> depends on Area A, so it varies.
Electric field depends on A, so it varies.
